name: NGO Shipbreaking Platform
goal: The NGO Shipbreaking Platform is a global coalition of human rights and environmantal organisations working to ensure safe and environmantally sound ship dismantling world wide. The Platform has a strong focus on the practices of European ship owners and is closely working with the European Institutions to ensure effective European legislation on the issue.
interests: Development, Employment and Social Affairs, Environment, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Trade, Transport
euInitiatives: The Platform is advocating for European legislation to regulate the ship recycling practices of European ship owners, and contributes strongly to the development of the EU Ship Recycling Regulation which was adopted in December 2013. Currently, the Platform focuses on the implementation of the EU SRR including the set-up of the EU list of compliant ship recycling facilities and the adoption of a financial incentive to strengthen enforcement. The Platform additionally monitors the enforcement of the EU Waste Shipment Regulation for end-of-life ships and the development of EU maritime policies.
